docs.snippet: The British government is no longer top shareholder in Lloyds Banking Group after reducing its stake to below 6 percent as it aims to return the lender to full private ownership this year....
docs.lead_paragraph: The British government is no longer top shareholder in Lloyds Banking Group after reducing its stake to below 6 percent as it aims to return the lender to full private ownership this year.

headline.main: British Government No Longer Top Lloyds Shareholder
headline.print_headline: British Government No Longer Top Lloyds Shareholder

docs.snippet: Israeli police stepped up security measures in Arab neighborhoods in east Jerusalem on Monday, searching trucks and arresting relatives of the Palestinian truck driver who rammed his vehicle into a crowd of Israeli soldiers at a Jerusalem tourist ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Israeli police stepped up security measures in Arab neighborhoods in east Jerusalem on Monday, searching trucks and arresting relatives of the Palestinian truck driver who rammed his vehicle into a crowd of Israeli soldiers at a Jerusalem tourist spot the previous day, killing four soldiers and injuring 17 others.

headline.main: Israeli Police Arrest 9 Following Palestinian Truck Attack
headline.print_headline: Israeli Police Arrest 9 Following Palestinian Truck Attack

docs.snippet: ANKARA, Turkey (AP) — Turkey's Parliament on Monday kicked off debate on proposed constitutional amendments that would hand Recep Tayyip Erdogan's largely ceremonial presidency sweeping executive powers and Erdogan himself the possibility to...
docs.lead_paragraph: ANKARA, Turkey (AP) — Turkey's Parliament on Monday kicked off debate on proposed constitutional amendments that would hand Recep Tayyip Erdogan's largely ceremonial presidency sweeping executive powers and Erdogan himself the possibility to serve two more five-year terms.

headline.main: Turkey's Parliament Debates Giving Greater Powers to Erdogan
headline.print_headline: Turkey's Parliament Debates Giving Greater Powers to Erdogan

docs.snippet: Indonesia's President Joko Widodo reproached his military chief in a meeting last week amid concerns the commander was "out of control" after he unilaterally suspended defence cooperation with Australia, two sources briefed on the meeting said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Indonesia's President Joko Widodo reproached his military chief in a meeting last week amid concerns the commander was "out of control" after he unilaterally suspended defence cooperation with Australia, two sources briefed on the meeting said.

headline.main: Indonesia's President Moves to Rein in 'Out of Control' Military Chief
headline.print_headline: Indonesia's President Moves to Rein in 'Out of Control' Military Chief

docs.snippet: Bournemouth's record signing Jordon Ibe has been a disappointment, manager Eddie Howe has said following his side's third round exit from the FA Cup....
docs.lead_paragraph: Bournemouth's record signing Jordon Ibe has been a disappointment, manager Eddie Howe has said following his side's third round exit from the FA Cup.

headline.main: Record Signing Ibe a 'Disappointment', Says Howe
headline.print_headline: Record Signing Ibe a 'Disappointment', Says Howe

docs.snippet: McDonald’s said it would sell its businesses in mainland China and Hong Kong to Citic and the Carlyle Group for $2.08 billion....
docs.lead_paragraph: McDonald’s said it would sell its businesses in mainland China and Hong Kong to Citic and the Carlyle Group for $2.08 billion.

headline.main: McDonald’s China Operations to Be Sold to Locally Led Consortium
headline.print_headline: McDonald’s to Sell Its Operations in Mainland China

byline.original: By AMIE TSANG and SUI-LEE WEE

docs.snippet: Bovis Homes said its chief executive David Ritchie had quit just days after the British housebuilder warned on profit because it failed to complete the number of homes it expected at the end of 2016....
docs.lead_paragraph: Bovis Homes said its chief executive David Ritchie had quit just days after the British housebuilder warned on profit because it failed to complete the number of homes it expected at the end of 2016.

headline.main: Bovis Homes Chief Executive Pays Price for Profit Warning
headline.print_headline: Bovis Homes Chief Executive Pays Price for Profit Warning

docs.snippet: Iraqi troops in Mosul have battled their way to the Tigris River running through the center of town, marking a milestone in the nearly three-month-old offensive aimed at reclaiming the northern city from Islamic State militants....
docs.lead_paragraph: Iraqi troops in Mosul have battled their way to the Tigris River running through the center of town, marking a milestone in the nearly three-month-old offensive aimed at reclaiming the northern city from Islamic State militants.

headline.main: Battling IS, Iraq Troops Reach Bank of Tigris River in Mosul
headline.print_headline: Battling IS, Iraq Troops Reach Bank of Tigris River in Mosul

docs.snippet: German exports jumped more than expected in November, posting their steepest monthly rise in four-and-half years and pushing up overall industrial production which drove growth in Europe's biggest economy in the final quarter....
docs.lead_paragraph: German exports jumped more than expected in November, posting their steepest monthly rise in four-and-half years and pushing up overall industrial production which drove growth in Europe's biggest economy in the final quarter.

headline.main: Strong German Industry Output, Exports Point to Fourth Quarter Rebound
headline.print_headline: Strong German Industry Output, Exports Point to Fourth Quarter Rebound

docs.snippet: Worsening conditions brought unhealthy levels of pollution to parts of southern China, including Hong Kong, on Monday. Beijing’s smog started to clear....
docs.lead_paragraph: Worsening conditions brought unhealthy levels of pollution to parts of southern China, including Hong Kong, on Monday. Beijing’s smog started to clear.

headline.main: Southern China Is Blanketed in Smog as Beijing Gets Slight Reprieve
headline.print_headline: Smog Coats South China as Beijing Gets a Break

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Beijing, and Alan Wong from Hong Kong.
